entries.meaning: (uncountable) Solid residue from roasting coal in a coke oven; used principally as a fuel and in the production of steel and formerly as a domestic fuel.
examples: The plant should produce approximately 550,000 tons of screened blast furnace coke per year.

verbs.description: coke (third-person singular simple present cokes, present participle coking, simple past and past participle coked)

entries.meaning: (especially automotive, astronautics) To add deleterious carbon deposits as a byproduct of combustion.
examples: In kerolox engines, some of the fuel flow cokes in the engine's cooling passages over time, requiring thorough cleaning prior to reuse.

description: Originated circa 1908 in American English as a clipping of cocaine.
1909, from the name of the American company Coca-Cola and the beverage it produced; the drink was named for two of its original ingredients, coca leaves and cola nut.

entries.meaning: (uncountable, informal) Alternative letter-case form of Coke (cola-based soft drink, especially Coca-Cola).
(countable, informal) Alternative letter-case form of Coke (a serving of cola-based soft drink, especially Coca-Cola).
(US, chiefly Southern US, informal) Alternative letter-case form of Coke (any soft drink, regardless of type).
